questions.question: The puppy or the kitten ………………………. the cheese.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Neither you nor I ………………………. fit for this job.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns or pronouns with neither/nor, the verb agrees with the noun/pronoun closest to nor.

questions.question: Either he or you ………………………. to do the shopping.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns or pronouns with either/or, the verb agrees with the noun/pronoun closest to or.

questions.question: Neha …………………………… what to do after school.
The Chairman along with the Secretary …………………………. present at the meeting.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with along with, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: Both the manager and the assistant manager …………………………… expected to be present at the meeting.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with and, the verb is plural.

questions.question: One of my cousins …………………………. to be an archeologist.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: A famous poet and singer ………………………. in this neighborhood.
questions.description: Here both nouns refer to the same person hence we use a singular verb.

questions.question: The woman who …………………………. next door is a writer.
questions.description: The verb or a relative clause agrees with its antecedent.

questions.question: The price of essential commodities ……………………….. gone up.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun price.

questions.question: A mother sparrow with her chicks ………………………. in that nest.
questions.description: When two nouns are connected with 'with', the verb agrees with the former noun.

questions.question: Neither answer …………………………… correct to me.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either or neither.

questions.question: The performance of the students ………………………….. excellent.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun performance.

questions.question: More than 10,000 kilometers ………………………. India from Europe.
questions.description: When we talk about distance expressions like 10,000 kilometers are treated as singular.

questions.question: One of my sisters ……………………….. abroad.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular expression one.

questions.question: Neither of them ……………………….. here.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: Everybody ………………………. come.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after every, everybody, everyone etc.

questions.question: Each of the students …………………………. punished.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each, every.

questions.question: One of the students ……………………….. missing.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: The officer as well as the subordinates ………………………… present.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the first.

questions.question: Neither of the statements ………………………….. true.
Many parents ………………………… present at the meeting.
She always ……………………….. fault with others.
questions.description: The subject is the singular pronoun she.

questions.question: The moon as well as the stars ………………………. us light.
One of my friends ............................ in Romania.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular expression one.

questions.question: Each of the boys ............................... given a booklet.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each and every.

questions.question: Oil and water ............................... not mix.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with and, the verb should be plural.

questions.question: Slow and steady ................................ the race.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either Sam or Maria ................................. responsible for this.
questions.description: When you connect two singular nouns with either/or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either Samuel or his friends ............................... taken the money.
questions.description: When we connect a singular and a plural subject with either/or, the verb agrees with the subject nearest to it.

questions.question: There .................................. a lot of mangoes on the tree.
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There .............................. a lot of work to do.
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Where .................................. you been all this while?
The boss and her secretary ............................... lunch together.
Neither of these hats .................................... your face.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after neither.

questions.question: Everyone ..................................... honest people.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after everyone.

questions.question: Neither praise nor censure ………………………. to affect him.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Neither he nor his servants ……………………………. aware of the happenings.
questions.description: When we connect a singular noun and a plural noun with neither/nor, the verb agrees with the number and person of the noun closest to it.

questions.question: No house or shop ……………………………. left unsearched.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either he or I ……………………………… mistaken.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with either/or, the verb agrees in number and person with the noun closest to it.

questions.question: Either you or he ……………………………… right.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with either/or, the verb agrees in number and person with the noun closest to it.

questions.question: One of them ……………………………… agreed to come.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun one.

questions.question: None of these books ……………………………. taught me anything worthwhile.
questions.description: None is usually followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: James, who ………………………….. my friend, has agreed to come with me.
questions.description: The verb in the relative clause agrees with its antecedent in number and person.

questions.question: I who …………………………….. your guardian will take care of you.
questions.description: The verb in the relative clause agrees with its antecedent in number and person.

questions.question: A lot of work ………………………………. to be done.
questions.description: When a lot of is followed by an uncountable noun, the verb is singular in number.

questions.question: A lot of people ……………………………….. to buy cars.
questions.description: When a lot of followed by a plural noun, the verb is plural in number.

questions.question: Plenty of books …………………………….. available on this subject.
Both of us ……………………….. present there.
questions.description: Both of us is a plural expression hence, the verb has to be in the plural form.

questions.question: All of my friends ………………………… been invited to my party.
questions.description: Use a plural verb after all.

questions.question: Each one of these apples …………………………….. ripe.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: She and I ………………………….. working on a new project.
questions.description: She and I is a plural expression.

questions.question: Neither red nor black …………………………… me.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either Rita or Janet ……………………………. eaten the ice-cream.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with either/or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Neither my father nor my mother ……………………………. going to the party.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either you or I ………………………………… in the wrong.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with either/or, the verb agrees in number and person with the subject closest to it.

questions.question: No news ……………………………….. bad news.
questions.description: News is uncountable in English. It is used with a singular noun.

questions.question: None of the boys ………………………………. wearing a cap.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after none of.

questions.question: Neither James nor his colleagues …………………………….. in the office.
questions.description: When we connect a singular and a plural noun with neither/nor, the verb agrees with the noun closest to it.

questions.question: My trousers ……………………………… blue in colour.
questions.description: Use a plural verb with jeans, trousers, pants, scissors etc.

questions.question: He and his wife ……………………….. arrived.
questions.description: Two or more singular nouns connected by and take a plural verb.

questions.question: Oil and water ……………………… not agree.
questions.description: Two or more singular nouns connected by and take a plural verb.

questions.question: My mentor and benefactor ………………………. no more.
questions.description: When two singular nouns refer to the same person, we use a singular verb.

questions.question: The secretary and the chairman ……………………………. present at the meeting.
questions.description: Here the articles used with the two nouns indicate that they refer to different people and hence we use a plural verb.

questions.question: Each person …………………………. a vote.
questions.description: We use a singular noun and a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Each day ………………………… its own challenges.
questions.description: We use a singular noun and a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Neither Rahul nor Rohan ………………………… passed the exam.
questions.description: The verb is singular when two or more singular nouns are connected by nor.

questions.question: Either Peter or James ………………………. left his umbrella in the classroom.
questions.description: The verb is singular when two or more singular nouns are connected by or.

questions.question: Neither the manager nor his personal assistants ……………………… there.
questions.description: When the subjects joined by or or nor are of different number, the verb is plural. In this case, put the plural subject close to the verb.

questions.question: Neither he nor I ………………………… responsible for this.
questions.description: When the subjects connected by or or nor are of different persons, the verb agrees in person with the nearest subject.

questions.question: Neither you nor he ………………………… a good student.
questions.description: When the subjects connected by or or nor are of different persons, the verb agrees in person with the nearest subject.

questions.question: Everyone of them ……………………… there.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after every and everyone.

questions.question: The long and the short of the matter ………………………….. that we have been betrayed.
questions.description: The verb must be singular when two or more subjects together express one idea.

questions.question: The chairman and the secretary …………………………………. present.
questions.description: The verb must be plural when two or more singular subjects are connected by and.

questions.question: No nook or corner ……………………………… left unexplored.
questions.description: The verb must be singular when two or more singular subjects are connected by or.

questions.question: Neither Sam nor his brother …………………………….. present there.
questions.description: The verb must be singular when two or more singular subjects are connected by neither/nor.

questions.question: Does anyone …………………………… where Celia lives?
questions.description: The infinitive does not take the marker –s after do, does or did.

questions.question: ……………………………… she in love with somebody else?
He and I ……………………………. birds of the same feather.
questions.description: When two singular subjects are connected by and, the verb must be singular.

questions.question: Everybody …………………………….. frustrated by the delay.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after everybody.

questions.question: Tell the children to raise their …………………………….
questions.description: We usually use a plural noun after a plural possessive.

questions.question: Many people lost their …………………………… in the accident.
Neither the minister nor his secretary ………………………………. able to give a satisfactory explanation.
A good knowledge of at least three languages …………………………… essential for this job.
questions.description: Here the actual subject is the singular noun knowledge.

questions.question: The orator and philosopher ………………….. dead.
questions.description: Here the article is used only once and hence both nouns refer to the same person. Therefore, we need a singular verb here.

questions.question: The artist and the poet …………………….. arrived.
questions.description: Here the article the is used before both the nouns and hence they refer to different people. Therefore, we use a plural verb here.

questions.question: The long and the short of the matter ……………………….. that we cannot continue like this.
questions.description: When two subjects together express one idea, the verb is usually singular in number.

questions.question: Every man and woman …………………………. a vote.
questions.description: When singular subjects are preceded by each or every, the verb is usually singular.

questions.question: Neither Peter nor Harry ………………………… passed the exam.
questions.description: Two or more singular subjects connected by neither … nor take a singular verb.

questions.question: No nook or corner …………………………. left unexplored.
questions.description: Two or more singular subjects connected by or takes a singular verb.

questions.question: Either John or Sam ……………………….. to quit.
questions.description: Two or more singular subjects connected by either…or… take a singular verb.

questions.question: Either you or I ………………………. mistaken.
questions.description: When the subjects joined by or or nor are of different persons, the verb agrees in person with the subject nearest to it.

questions.question: He is not to blame, nor ……………………… you.
questions.description: When the subjects joined by or or nor are of different persons, the verb agrees in person with the subject nearest to it.

questions.question: You and he ………………………… birds of the same feather.
questions.description: When two singular pronouns are connected by and, the verb is plural.

questions.question: My father and I ………………………. lived here for many years.
questions.description: When two nouns are connected by and, the verb is plural.

questions.question: Neither praise nor censure ………………………. to bother him.
questions.description: Two or more singular subjects connected by neither … nor take a singular verb.

questions.question: Plutarch’s Lives ……………. an interesting book.
The United States ………………… one of the most influential countries in the world.
Thousand dollars …………… a huge sum.
Either you or I ………………. mistaken.
The leader, as well has his followers, …………… arrested.
Wool, as well as cotton, ………………… exported from India.
No news ……………… good news.
The king, with his ministers, …………….. coming.
Time and tide ………………. for none.
The state of his affairs …………….. a cause for concern.
Here are two pieces of shirting. Each one ………….. two meters long.
That woman ……………… got two children. Both ……………….. girls.
Few girls in this village …………………. to schools.
Some economists believe that all …………….. not well with the global economy.
He inherited a lot of wealth from his father, but now all ………………. gone.
…………………. all of the invitees expected to turn up?
I have two pens. But neither ………………… well.
“Which of these two flats would you like to buy? “ “Either …………….. me.”
Mr. Mathews is an advocate, but neither of his two sons …………….. good at studies.
The two countries have been at war for three years now. Neither …………….. to agree to a ceasefire.
